If you're looking for a film that explores the horrors of war and the resilience of the human spirit, then "Flags of Our Fathers" might be the movie for you. It tells the life stories of the six men who raised the flag at the Battle of Iwo Jima, a turning point in World War II.

If you're interested in a more dramatic and suspenseful film, then "Zero Dark Thirty" would be a great choice. It chronicles the decade-long hunt for al-Qaeda terrorist leader Osama bin Laden after the September 2001 attacks.

If you're seeking a thought-provoking film about the complexities of war and the human condition, then "Schindler's List" would be an excellent option. It tells the story of Oskar Schindler, an industrialist who gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.
